Ari Aster‚Äôs 2019 horror film Midsommar is now being released with a 171-minute director‚Äôs cut featuring Martin Scorsese‚Äôs introduction.

The collector‚Äôs edition includes a 62-page book created by Ragnar Persson, whose illustrations were included in the film. Persson took inspiration from murals in Sweden to do up the art, which was painted, drawn, and stitched onto various props in the film.

‚ÄúA couple of years ago, I watched a first film called¬†Hereditary¬†by a director named Ari Aster,‚Äù Scorsese wrote. ‚ÄúRight from the start, I was impressed.‚Äù

The new collector‚Äôs edition of¬†Midsommar¬†can be preordered via A24‚Äôs¬†website Link: https://shop.a24films.com/collections/all-products/products/midsommar-directors-cut-collectors-edition , and will be shipped by 20 July 2020.

Banksy‚Äôs prints racked up around US$138,000 in an art auction at the International Art Centre in Auckland, New Zealand.

Three of the prints were sold for world-record prices for the editions, and raked in US$45,000 to US$52,000 each.

Banksy‚Äôs Golf Sale print fetched US$45,000, his Super Mare print sold for US$41,000, while the artist‚Äôs Soup Can print sold for US$52,000.

‚ÄúBanksy had this idea that Andy Warhol‚Äôs image of the Campbell‚Äôs soup was just so expensive and so overpriced‚Ä¶ and he painted the Tesco version,‚Äù International Art Centre director Richard Thompson told 1 News Link: https://www.tvnz.co.nz/one-news/new-zealand/banksy-prints-sell-world-record-prices-auckland-auction about Banksy‚Äôs Soup Can art.

IKEA is known for offering furniture and other household products at affordable prices. This has allowed the Swedish giant to expand across the globe.

To help ensure that IKEA employees always provide good customer service, Insider Link: https://www.insider.com/things-you-should-never-do-at-an-ikea-according-to-employees asked staffers to share what customers shouldn‚Äôt do at the stoes. Scroll down for some key takeaways.

Refrain from eating while browsing

According to current and former employees of the flat-pack company, you should avoid eating and drinking in the display areas. Former IKEA employee Sonny Cartright Link: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sonny-cartright-2074171a5/ said that customers who consume food in the furniture display areas usually ‚Äúleave marks behind.‚Äù Stick to eating at food halls instead of taking your snacks with you to look for furniture.

Ensure your children do not mess up the furniture

If you bring kids to an IKEA store, do keep a close eye on them. ‚ÄúThere is nothing worse than children running through the store screaming, messing things up, and leaving sticky handprints everywhere,‚Äù Cartright said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs taxing on the staff and unfair to other customers.‚Äù

IKEA‚Äôs merchandise associate Kelly Roberts Link: https://www.linkedin.com/in/kelly-roberts-b55ba61a5/ also urged for parents to keep drinks out of the hands of their kids. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a recipe for disaster and if they end up spilling it we‚Äôre the ones that end up cleaning it up,‚Äù Roberts told Insider Link: https://www.insider.com/things-you-should-never-do-at-an-ikea-according-to-employees .

Parents can opt to have their kids play in IKEA‚Äôs Sm√•land playground, where trained staff members can watch them while you shop.

Don‚Äôt ask employees for staff discounts

Asking employees for staff discounts is frowned upon, Roberts revealed. ‚ÄúNot only does this put us in an awkward situation, it can also put our jobs in jeopardy,‚Äù she said.

If you wish to save money, sign up for the IKEA Family card.

Avoid getting too comfortable Link: https://designtaxi.com/news/409862/IKEA-Responds-To-Viral-Video-Of-Woman-Pleasuring-Herself-In-Showroom-In-China/ on the display furniture

Cartright advised customers not too get ‚Äútoo comfortable on the display furniture.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe once found that someone had used a display toilet for their own needs,‚Äù Cartright explained. ‚ÄúThere have been interesting finds in the beds, as well.‚Äù

While it is completely alright to test out furniture, getting under blankets or compromising on personal hygiene is discouraged on the store floor.

For a comprehensive list of things not to do at IKEA, read the full rundown here Link: https://www.insider.com/things-you-should-never-do-at-an-ikea-according-to-employees .

[via Insider Link: https://www.insider.com/things-you-should-never-do-at-an-ikea-according-to-employees , opening image via LCV / Shutterstock.com Link: https://shutterstock.7eer.net/c/1262811/42119/1305?u=https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/bucharest-romania-june-24-2019-ikea-1449237536 ] http://www.designtaxi.com/news/410556/IKEA-Employees-Share-What-Customers-Shouldn-t-Do-While-Shopping-In-Display-Halls/

Image via Shutterstock Link: https://shutterstock.7eer.net/c/1262811/42119/1305?u=https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/state-flag-mississippi-102509726

Black Lives Matter Link: https://designtaxi.com/category/BLM voices are finally being heard. After numerous failed attempts Link: https://www.dezeen.com/2020/07/01/mississippi-state-flag-redesign-confederacy/ to fix its state flag over the years, Mississippi passed a bill to remove the Confederate battle emblem from its state flag on 28 June.

The redesigned flag will feature the US motto seen on all paper bills‚Äî‚ÄúIn God We Trust‚Äù‚Äîtherefore replacing the blue saltire cross with white stars that was picked up by white supremacists during the civil rights movement in the 50s and 60s, according to Dezeen Link: https://www.dezeen.com/2020/07/01/mississippi-state-flag-redesign-confederacy/ .

The decision is in response to a call to remove symbols representing the Confederacy, which was established in 1861 by the seven slave-holding states Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi, South Carolina, and Texas. Mississippi is the last state to vote out its Confederacy emblem.

Legislature will be previewed the revamped look by 14 September, and members of the public will then vote on whether to keep this new version at a special election on 3 November.

The state will greenlight the redesign if the majority votes for it, but return to the drawing board if reception towards it is poor.

The bill reads, ‚ÄúIf a majority of the qualified electors vote against the new design, then the commission shall reconvene to recommend another new design for the Mississippi state flag to be presented to the legislature during the 2021 regular session.‚Äù

It also behests the takedown of the current flag from all Mississippi public buildings within 15 days.

Artist Takashi Murakami released an emotional 15-minute clip about the impacts of the coronavirus pandemic Link: https://designtaxi.com/category/COVID-19 .

Murakami stated that his Tokyo-based gallery and arts organization,¬†Kaikai Kiki Link: http://en.gallery-kaikaikiki.com/ , is now facing bankruptcy, leading to a number of his projects being canceled, as well.

His sci-fi feature film Jellyfish Eyes Part 2: Mahashankh, for one, has terminated production due to the spread of the virus. ‚ÄúFor nine long years, I had persevered! It was a film that was to realize my childish dreams!‚Äù Murakami shared in the clip.

However, he suggested that the film might be available in a series of videos focusing on the disruption. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how many episodes the series will end up being, but a series it will be, so please come along with me on this journey for a little while,‚Äù he added.

Watch his heartfelt message below.

View this post on Instagram Link: https://www.instagram.com/tv/CCEDqIQlmy5/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading

This spring, I streamed a series of cooking show of a sort on Instagram Live. I‚Äôm sure those who watched them were utterly confused, but I was trying to buoy my own thoroughly sunken feelings through these streamings. With the sudden swoop of COVID-19 pandemic, my company faced bankruptcy and I had to give up on a number of projects, the most symbolic of which being the production of my sci-fi feature film, Jellyfish Eyes Part 2: Mahashankh. For nine long years, I had persevered! It was a film that was to realize my childish dreams! The enormous budget I poured into this project, as well as my tenacious persistence, put a constant and tremendous stress on my company‚Äôs operation for the past nine years. But at the same time, I was able to endure various hardships because I had this project. Faced with the current predicament, however, I was persuaded by both my business consultant and tax attorney that I must, simply must try and drastically reduce our business tax by filing the film‚Äôs production cost as tax-exempt expenditure. To that end, I am going to produce and release a series of videos to publicly announce the discontinuation of the film‚Äôs production. (To be clear, this is an entirely legitimate procedure‚ÄîI‚Äôm not trying to evade tax!) These videos will be released against the backdrop of our struggle to avoid an economic catastrophe, but perhaps it may have a cathartic effect on the viewers/my followers to see the story of stupid Murakami‚Äôs failure. Long story short, I‚Äôm a silly human being for whom the moment of bliss is when I am thinking my truly childish sci-fi thoughts. I don‚Äôt know how many episodes the series will end up being, but a series it will be, so please come along with me on this journey for a little while. It turns out that most fans have been pronouncing Charlize Theron‚Äôs name wrongly.

The actress finally decided to clear things up during an appearance on The One Show. Theron was asked by host Gethin Jones if fans should put emphasis on the first or second syllable of her name, and she revealed that it was neither.

‚ÄúThe truth of the matter is those are not even remotely close to the real pronunciation,‚Äù she laughed. She shared that her last name is actually enunciated more like the word ‚Äúthrone,‚Äù with a slight roll of the ‚Äúr‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúTherrone.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs actually French,‚Äù she clarified. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a French name, but in South Africa, if you are Afrikaans-speaking, you would say ‚ÄòThron,‚Äô and if you were English-speaking you would say ‚ÄòTherrone‚Äô.‚Äù

Jenner propped up her camera at home during the coronavirus pandemic Link: https://designtaxi.com/category/COVID-19 to capture new self-portraits using her own computer.

The model is seen wearing the brand‚Äôs TB summer monogram collection with an updated look of the Peter Saville-designed TB logo prints first introduced by chief creative officer¬†Riccardo Tisci in 2018.

The new TB logo is a little bigger and comes with new shades like azure blue, graphite, and cobalt blue with orange accents. The initials pay tribute to the founder Thomas Burberry.

The collection features summer pieces, including a sporty bikini and a bright bodysuit worn by Jenner. The project was directed with the help of creatives Nick Night and Katy England, who worked on the video featuring CGI geometric designs that reflect skateparks and swimming pools.

A live broadcast captured a CNN reporter in Brazil being mugged by a homeless man.

Bruna Macedo and her news crew were stationed near the Bandeiras Bridge in S√£o Paulo to report about the rising water level in the Tiet√™ River due to heavy rainfall.

As Macedo was speaking to her anchor colleague, Rafael Colombo, the suspect was seen in the background, looking over the bridge barrier. He then walked towards Macedo, who greeted him while her coworker spoke about the flooding points in the city.

The man then pulled out a knife, which shocked Macedo. She took a few steps back and handed over her smartphone before the camera panned away and focused on the shot of the street. Macedo also handed over her second smartphone before the mugger left the scene.

Colombo told Brazilian newspaper Folha de Sao Paulo that Macedo was not injured, and that she returned to the CNN center after the incident.

Colombo said she ‚Äúhad a terrible scare‚Äù but was ‚Äúfine.‚Äù

Smartphone makers tend to be incredibly secretive about upcoming products, so it‚Äôs especially amusing when they end up being the ones to shoot themselves in the foot. For Samsung, this has happened more than once. In 2018, the South Korean tech giant unintentionally dropped the launch video for the Galaxy S9 a mere day ahead Link: https://designtaxi.com/news/398431/Samsung-Galaxy-S9-Launch-Video-Goes-Online-A-Day-Ahead-Phone-s-Announcement/ of the supposed debut. Now, it seems to have leaked images of the upcoming Galaxy Note 20 Ultra on its official website, even though an unveiling is only expected in August.

Russian tech YouTuber Techno Harry Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2iCYxpqZYZs recently uncovered images of what looked to be the anticipated smartphone on the Samsung Russia website Link: https://www.samsung.com/ru/smartphones/galaxy-note8/ , under the Galaxy Note 8 landing page. The model was evidently not the Galaxy Note 8, and if earlier leaks Link: https://bgr.com/2020/05/25/galaxy-note-20-plus-leak-design-update-camera/ are to be believed, the design instead matched that of the forthcoming Galaxy Note 20 Ultra instead.

The photos appeared to depict the Galaxy Note 20 Ultra in a ‚ÄòMystic Bronze‚Äô, along with a camera configuration of three sensors aligned vertically on the left and the others on the right.

The listing was taken down shortly after it was discovered.

Samsung is only expected to announce the Galaxy Note 20 series during the Galaxy Unpacked event, which is speculated to take place virtually on 5 August. A less significant detail the rumor mill hasn‚Äôt fully agreed on is the name of the larger model; apart from Galaxy Note 20 Ultra, some are calling it the Galaxy Note 20+.

When you‚Äôre dealt a bad hand at your next photoshoot, vexing won‚Äôt be an option. Simply keep your poker face on and get these playing cards out.

The Photography Deck Link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/travel9to5/photography-deck is an intriguing and educational take on classic playing cards that intertwines card games with photography rules and methods. The set, designed by filmmaker Eric Bohring Link: https://travel9to5.com/ , serves as a pocket-sized cheat sheet to help you shuffle new concepts into your photography work in a flash.

Here, the traditional suits‚Äîspades, hearts, clubs, and diamonds‚Äîare respectively replaced with the categories of Camera Basics, Composition, Technical Info, and Shooting Styles. Perhaps even more amusingly so, the court cards‚ÄîKing, Queen, Jack, and Joker‚Äîhave been given cameras, too.

While novices might chance upon ideal photographic conditions now and then, this deck ensures you won‚Äôt have to take that gamble. Find out more about The Photography Deck, which is currently on Kickstarter mode, here Link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/travel9to5/photography-deck .

Video screenshot via Apple

With working from home taking over as the norm, you might be on the lookout for quality apps to not only simplify your workflow but also keep you thoroughly entertained during the COVID-19 downtime.

In a timely fashion, Apple unveiled its picks for the Apple Design Awards 2020 during the WWDC developer conference, revealing a curation of apps to consider installing especially if you‚Äôve been in a bit of a creative rut lately.

This year, Apple commended four creativity apps and four games from the App Store and Apple Arcade that it deems to be the best-designed of 2020. Check them out below.

Best apps

Shapr3D for iPad

Shapr3D is an iPad drawing app that lets you create 3D drawings without having to use a desktop computer or CAD software. Designs created in this ‚Äúpro-level‚Äù tool are compatible with major CAD file formats and support instant exports for 3D printing.

Link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/shapr-3d-cad-modeling/id1091675654

Looom for iPad

Looom lets you create hand-drawn animations within the iPad. It also doesn‚Äôt matter if you use your finger or Apple Pencil, or if you have animation experience or not. The interface is deliberately simple so anyone can animate their illustrations to life.

Link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/looom/id1454153126

StaffPad for iPad

Another iPad tool on the list is StaffPad, an app for writing music. Here, you‚Äôll be able to scribble notes, add articulation marks, and then play your composition using virtual orchestral instruments.

Link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/staffpad/id1442074103

Darkroom for iPhone and iPad

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Darkroom (@usedarkroom) on Aug 6, 2019 at 6:49am PDT

Everyone needs a good photo editor in their phone, and Apple thinks Darkroom is among the best of them. The powerful app arrives not only with basic editing toggles and moody filters, but also pro features like a curves editor and the ability to open RAW files, batch-edit, as well as create custom filters.

Link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/darkroom-photo-video-editor/id953286746

Best games

Sayonara Wild Hearts for iPhone, iPad, Mac, and AppleTV

Sayonara Wild Hearts is a poetic arcade game that embodies 80s music video vibes. The objective of the artsy game is to heal your broken heart, which you‚Äôll have to work towards on journeys across dreamy landscapes on a motorbike and ‚Äúthe occasional detour into balletic battle sequences.‚Äù The experience gets even more euphoric with the game‚Äôs synth-fueled soundtrack‚Ä¶ and Queen Latifah‚Äôs voice.

Link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/sayonara-wild-hearts/id1441675161

Song of Bloom for iPhone and iPad

Song of Bloom is an abstract nonlinear puzzle game that forces you to think out of the box to solve challenges. There is more to this, but as Apple mentions, ‚ÄúGiving too much away [about the game] would spoil the fun.‚Äù

Link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/song-of-bloom/id1479162134

Where Cards Fall for iPhone, iPad, Mac, and AppleTV

Where Cards Fall is a puzzle game that has you building houses of cards to travel across trance-like levels. However, there‚Äôs a twist. Each level signifies a unique memory, and as you advance through the game, you will piece together fragments to learn the full surprising and ‚Äútearjerking‚Äù story of the protagonist.

Link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/where-cards-fall/id1466331487

Sky: Children of the Light for iPhone and iPad

The compelling Sky: Children of the Light‚Äîcreated by the makers of award-winning game Journey‚Äîis a relaxing, visually-rich multiplayer game that rewards you based on generosity, of all things, instead of stealth and physical strength. Players team up to help one another solve puzzles and unlock secrets.

Image courtesy of LEGO Link: https://www.lego.com/

The imaginative young at heart will soon be able to rekindle one of their most joyous childhood activities yet. The LEGO Group has announced a collection of arty sets, designed specifically for pop culture-loving adults, to serve their need for creative fulfillment.

The new LEGO¬Æ Art series features four nostalgic sets created in collaboration with the Andy Warhol Foundation, The Beatles, Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm. Fans start out with a blank canvas and build their way to recreating Andy Warhol‚Äôs 1967 screenprint of Marilyn Monroe, portraits of The Beatles, an artwork of Iron Man in one of three suits of armor, as well as portraits of Star Wars villains, using 2D LEGO tiles.

To further divert your attention from adulting stresses, you can listen to accompanying bespoke soundtracks of interviews with professionals familiar with these pop culture icons. The relaxing anecdotes ‚Äúdive deep into the inspiration behind each design to help adults fully immerse themselves in the building experience and unwind while they explore their love of music, art or film in a new way,‚Äù LEGO shared in a press statement.

Once you‚Äôre done with the therapeutic setup, you can display the stunning art in your room or office and look at it all day with a renewed sense of accomplishment.

The Marvel Studios Iron Man set will debut in LEGO retail stores and LEGO.com Link: https://www.lego.com/ on 1 August, and the other three kits will be released in stores from 1 September in the US.

The Queer Eye members spent the whole of season five giving Philadelphia a glow-up, and even stopped by to zhuzh up Gritty the Philadelphia Flyers mascot.

The cast members of Netflix‚Äôs award-winning series met America‚Äôs second-most famous orange character in a bonus episode, shown below. Gritty should be well aware of the attention his unusual looks have been getting‚Äîwhen he debuted in September 2018, the bearded ice hockey mascot was ridiculed for his ferocious presence, intense gaze, and exaggerated grin.

All the memes Link: https://designtaxi.com/news/402290/Humorous-Yet-Harrowing-Me-Voting-In-2016-VS-In-2018-Meme-Takes-Over-The-Web/ about his appearance were bound to make the endearing icon question his self-esteem now and then. Luckily, Antoni Porowski, Bobby Berk, Jonathan Van Ness, Karamo Brown, and Tan France were here to make the gritty a little more pretty.

Gritty was nominated by Phillie Phanatic, the green bird mascot of the Phillies Major League Baseball team. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think Gritty needs to change a ton. Maybe you guys can convince him that he doesn‚Äôt need to eat a cheesesteak for every meal,‚Äù Phillie Phanatic wrote in his letter.

The Fab Five then did their magic, grooming his eyebrows, showing him how to transform his outfits along with the signature French tuck, overhauling his locker room, and teaching him self-love. Not forgetting his fellow mascot friend‚Äôs advice, they showed him other meals to incorporate into his diet besides Philly cheesesteaks.

At the end of it, Gritty became the very best version of himself.

Working from home has become the new norm during the coronavirus pandemic Link: https://designtaxi.com/category/COVID-19 , and many companies have turned to video conferences to hold meetings and discussions. Though most people seem to be presentable and ready on camera, there is more to that frame that you don‚Äôt get to see.

Dubai-based agency Nomads Link: https://www.wearenomads.com/ has collected several images and videos of people during video calls and uploaded them to an Instagram page called The Bottom Half Link: https://www.instagram.com/the.bottom.half/ . As the name suggests, the photos and videos depict what goes on beneath the camera‚Äôs normal view.

The page hopes to bring a smile to everyone‚Äôs face by shedding light on the reality of working from home amid these rough times.

Have a glimpse at some of the best scenes below. To take part, all you have to do is send a direct message to The Bottom Half‚Äôs Instagram account Link: https://www.instagram.com/the.bottom.half/ .

With anti-racism protests Link: https://designtaxi.com/category/BLM taking place around the world, many are calling out culturally offensive Link: https://designtaxi.com/news/410493/The-Office-Pulls-Blackface-Scene-To-Reaffirm-Intolerance-For-Bad-Work-Culture/ characters in television shows and films. One such culprit is the longstanding hit series, The Simpsons.

Apu Nahasapeemapetilon, an Indian character, was played by Hank Azaria, a white man. Azaria has since dropped the character, as well as the other characters of color he voiced in the show, namely Carl, Lou, Julio, and Bumblebee Man.

The show‚Äôs producers have promised that ‚Äúmoving forward, The Simpsons will no longer have white actors voice non-white characters,‚Äù per Deadline Link: https://deadline.com/2020/06/the-simpsons-will-no-longer-have-white-actors-voice-non-white-characters-1202971437/ .

Jenny Slate also stepped down from her role as Missy in Big Mouth. In addition, Mike Henry decided to quit being the voice of the Brown character in Family Guy.

Two Ryanair pilots are currently under investigation after a video of them operating a throttle lever of an aircraft using a rubber chicken surfaced online.

The air carrier criticized the ‚Äúunprofessional‚Äù conduct of its pilots after watching the video of the pilots in the cockpit of the parked aircraft. The clip was said to have been filmed while passengers were boarding.

The pilots were playing with their toy, and one of them squeezed and used it to push the lever of the aircraft. The clip also showed rosary beads hanging from one of the levers inside the cockpit.

The scenes circulated online, prompting anger from internet users. ‚ÄúThis is so unprofessional and makes me worry what else is going on in the cockpit. This is a terrible look for Ryanair,‚Äù one concerned user said,

A spokesperson for Ryanair said that the photos and video showed the crew was on the ground and in a parked aircraft. ‚ÄúWhile the images are unprofessional, the actions in them posed no risk and safety was never compromised,‚Äù they said. ‚ÄúWe encourage our crew to enjoy their work, however, we expect them to remain professional at all times and we are investigating the matter further.‚Äù

TGI Fridays in the UK is reopening its doors to customers once again under a new brand identity and logo.

The restaurant now goes by a spanking new name: Fridays. With a ‚Äúsimplified‚Äù menu, the brand decided to drop its catchy TGI prefix that rolled off the tongue since the restaurant opened its doors in 1965.

Now known as ‚ÄúFridays,‚Äù the company has also unveiled its new logo on its official Twitter account.

The new wordmark sees the removal of the letters ‚ÄúTGI‚Äù and the word ‚ÄúFridays‚Äù housed in a decorative black border. The mobile logo, on the other hand, has more character as the brand is plastered against a red-and-white striped background.

The word ‚ÄúFridays‚Äù is spelled out with a plain sans serif font. The social media avatar features the letter ‚ÄúF‚Äù in a black condensed border. According to Brand New Link: https://www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/new_logo_for_tgi_fridays_uk.php , the Fridays wordmark isn‚Äôt properly aligned inside the border, therefore it looks heavy on the left side.

According to the restaurant, the rebrand aims Link: https://www.tgifridays.co.uk/famous-at-fridays/ to bring back ‚Äúthat Fridays feeling‚Äù among consumers along with a brand new menu.

New logo, new menu, new look! You may notice a few more changes happening ‚Äì stay tuned to find out what else is coming üëÄ
